name: cli-driver
description: like webdriver but for the command line

scripts.test-critical-coverage-html-report: rm -rf coverage; nyc --clean -r lcov -e .ts -x "*Spec.ts" ts-node node_modules/jasmine/bin/jasmine --config=./spec/support/jasmine-critical.json
scripts.help:
node -p "'
Help on this package's npm scripts:
'+JSON.stringify(JSON.parse(require('shelljs').cat('package.json').toString())['scripts-description'], null, 2)+'
'"
scripts.prettier: npx prettier  --write --arrow-parens avoid --parser typescript --use-tabs false --no-semi true --single-quote true --tab-width 2 --trailing-comma none --end-of-line lf --prose-wrap preserve --print-width 120  --jsx-bracket-same-line true "src/**/*.ts*" "spec/**/*.ts*"
scripts.all: npm run clean && npm run prettier && npm run build && npm test

scripts-description.npm test: run critical tests. By default, tests are run using ts-node. You can filter test to run but entering for example: 'npm test -- **/writeSpec.ts'
scripts-description.npm run test-js: run critical tests but instead using ts-node compiles them with tsc and runs compiled JavaScript code
scripts-description.npm run build: run critical tests compiled with tsc and running compiled JavaScript code
scripts-description.npm run watch: continuously run TypeScript compiler when changes on .ts files are detected
